Core.desc: The core of MooTools, contains all the base functions and the Native and Hash implementations. Required by all the other scripts.

Browser.desc: The Browser Core. Contains Browser initialization, Window and Document, and the Browser Hash.

Array.desc: Contains Array Prototypes like copy, each, contains, and remove.

Function.desc: Contains Function Prototypes like create, bind, pass, and delay.

Number.desc: Contains Number Prototypes like limit, round, times, and ceil.

String.desc: Contains String Prototypes like camelCase, capitalize, test, and toInt.

Hash.desc: Contains Hash Prototypes. Provides a means for overcoming the JavaScript practical impossibility of extending native Objects.

Event.desc: Contains the Event Class, to make the event object Crossbrowser.

Class.desc: Contains the Class Function for easily creating, extending, and implementing reusable Classes.

Class.Extras.desc: Contains Utility Classes that can be implemented into your own Classes to ease the execution of many common tasks.

Element.desc: One of the most important items in MooTools. Contains the dollar function, the dollars function, and an handful of cross-browser, time-saver methods to let you easily work with HTML Elements.

Element.Event.desc: Contains Element methods for dealing with events. This file also includes mouseenter and mouseleave custom Element Events.

Element.Style.desc: Contains methods for interacting with the styles of Elements in a fashionable way.

Element.Dimensions.desc: Contains methods to work with size, scroll, or positioning of Elements and the window object.

Selectors.desc: Adds advanced CSS-style querying capabilities for targeting HTML Elements. Includes pseudo selectors.

Cookie.desc: Class for creating, reading, and deleting browser Cookies.

Swiff.desc: Wrapper for embedding SWF movies. Supports External Interface Communication.

Fx.desc: Contains the basic animation logic to be extended by all other Fx Classes.

Fx.CSS.desc: Contains the CSS animation logic. Used by Fx.Tween, Fx.Morph, Fx.Elements.

Fx.Tween.desc: Formerly Fx.Style, effect to transition any CSS property for an element.

Fx.Morph.desc: Formerly Fx.Styles, effect to transition any number of CSS properties for an element using an object of rules, or CSS based selector rules.

Fx.Transitions.desc: Contains a set of advanced transitions to be used with any of the Fx Classes.

Request.desc: Powerful all purpose Request Class. Uses XMLHTTPRequest.

Request.HTML.desc: Extends the basic Request Class with additional methods for interacting with HTML responses.

Request.JSON.desc: Extends the basic Request Class with additional methods for sending and receiving JSON data.

Fx.Slide.desc: Effect to slide an element in and out of view.

Fx.Scroll.desc: Effect to smoothly scroll any element, including the window.

Fx.Elements.desc: Effect to change any number of CSS properties of any number of Elements.

Drag.desc: The base Drag Class. Can be used to drag and resize Elements using mouse events.

Drag.Move.desc: A Drag extension that provides support for the constraining of draggables to containers and droppables.

Color.desc: Class for creating and manipulating colors in JavaScript. Supports HSB -> RGB Conversions and vice versa.

Group.desc: Class for monitoring collections of events.

Hash.Cookie.desc: Class for creating, reading, and deleting browser Cookies in JSON format.

Sortables.desc: Class for creating a drag and drop sorting interface for lists of items.

Tips.desc: Class for creating nice tooltips that follow the mouse cursor when hovering over an element.

SmoothScroll.desc: Class for creating a smooth scrolling effect to all internal links on the page.

Slider.desc: Class for creating horizontal and vertical slider controls.

Scroller.desc: Class which scrolls the contents of any Element (including the window) when the mouse reaches the Element's boundaries.

Assets.desc: Provides methods to dynamically load JavaScript, CSS, and Image files into the document.

Accordion.desc: An Fx.Elements extension which allows you to easily create accordion type controls.
